Class Helicopter

  • java.lang.Object
    • greenfoot.Actor
      • Helicopter

  • public class Helicopter
extends greenfoot.Actor
    This is a helicopter that flies around the map and can be controlled by the user to shoot at the location of the mouse
    Version:
    18/01/2019
    Author:
    Michael

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Helicopter(int roundsAlive)
      Creates a helicopter which flies around and can shoot

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void act()
      Act - do whatever the Helicopter wants to do.
      void animate()
      animates the helicopter
      void flyAway()
      Makes the helicopter fly away after 5 rounds
      void moveCycle()
      makes the helicopter move in a rectangular pattern
      void rotate()
      sets the rotation of the helicopter

    • Constructor Detail

      • Helicopter

        public Helicopter(int roundsAlive)
        Creates a helicopter which flies around and can shoot
        Parameters:
        roundsAlive - The amount of rounds the helicopter has been alive so that it can be properly loaded from a save file

    • Method Detail

      • act

        public void act()
        Act - do whatever the Helicopter wants to do. This method is called whenever the 'Act' or 'Run' button gets pressed in the environment.
        Overrides:
        act in class greenfoot.Actor
